data.Title: Google Updates Algorithms to Combat Deepfakes
data.Description: Google has updated its algorithms to demote deepfake content in Google Search, making it easier to remove deepfakes and expanding "About this image" to Circle to Search and Google Lens.

data.Title: Google Search Ranking Volatility Remains High
data.Description: Google Search ranking volatility remained high throughout July, possibly indicating a new algorithm update.  SEOs and webmasters are observing significant fluctuations in website rankings.

data.Title: Reddit Blocks Bing and Other Search Engines From Accessing Content Without Payment
data.Description: Reddit has blocked search engines, including Microsoft's Bing, from accessing its content unless they sign commercial agreements. The policy change, which took effect last month, aims to prevent companies from using Reddit's data to train AI models without permission.

data.Title: Google Ads Reporting Outage
data.Description: Google Ads is experiencing an outage that is impacting ad reporting and some interfaces. Google is currently working on resolving the issue.

data.Title: Outbrain Acquires Teads in $1 Billion Deal
data.Description: Outbrain has acquired Teads in a deal valued at over $1 billion. The deal brings together two major players in the native advertising space.

data.Title: Microsoft Reports Strong Q4 Earnings, Advertising Revenue Up 19%
data.Description: Microsoft reported strong fourth-quarter 2024 earnings, with search and advertising revenue up 19%. This marks the highest quarterly growth for the segment in over two years.

data.Title: Google to Charge Canadian Advertisers 2.5% Surcharge
data.Description: Google will charge Canadian advertisers a 2.5% surcharge on top of their ad spend. This surcharge is new for Canada but not for several other countries.

data.Title: New York Times and Other News Sites Block OpenAI's SearchGPT Web Crawler
data.Description: Several top news sites, including The New York Times, have blocked OpenAI's new SearchGPT web crawling bot. The move comes as publishers express concerns about the use of their content for AI training.

data.Title: Google Acquires Character.AI's Technology and Team
data.Description: Google has agreed to pay a licensing fee to chatbot maker Character.AI for its models and will hire its cofounders and many of its researchers.

data.Title: Wix Launches AI-Powered Blog Post Writer
data.Description: Wix has announced a suite of AI tools that automate the process of cultivating organic traffic with authentic content, including a tool that can write entire blog posts with SEO keywords.
